review: In my perception, this is how every task/to-do app should be like. The app's interface is fairly good too, but the dark theme is too light to be called "dark". I appreciate that it has a statistics feature and that it separates "today" and "future" tasks in the same page unlike other popular apps. It is certainly super useful... There is swipe to mark complete, but there is no animation; it feels weird to use. The app needs some simple animation(s) to make it feel good.
I6j64d: Dairy App & Notes & Audio Editor & Voice Recorder
ras4vb: Hi, thanks for your feedback. Your suggestion is very good and we will evaluate it carefully. If you like this app, can you rate it 5 stars? Thank you for your support! ðŸ’—

review: This is a nice app. I loved the themes. And it really helps us to manage all our tasks efficiently. We can categorize our tasks and complete it accordingly. The app also allows us to have it on our home screen so we don't open it again and again. There are also no unnecessary ads shown. But yes, there is one irritating part that the pop up for premium membership always comes up whenever I open the app. Please fix this problem. Otherwise, it is a very comfortable app. 5 stars from my side!ðŸ‘Œ

UNWANTED ADS. The whole point of this kind of productivity apps is it helps you stay focused and organised. What's the point if in every few minutes I get an ad of game or whatever. We can't even close it. We're forced to watch the whole thing. Very poor thing to add to your such a good app. UNINSTALLING IT.
I6j64d: Dairy App & Notes & Audio Editor & Voice Recorder

review: I've just started using the app. The software is clean and easy to use. The app doesn't show any ads but unfortunately most aesthetic flexibilities are for paid users only. I'm really looking forward to using the app everyday. I'll update this review if or when my feelings change. Update: Used it for a day. They give ads and it's annoying. I recommend switching to todoist cause it's essentially the same without constant bugging adverts.

You can also purchase VIP services to delete all ads in the app

review: The good: easy to use, one-time purchase option (I don't like subs, but will upgrade when necessary), it's not terribly expensive for a one time purchase, and I like the lists at the top. The bad: spammy notifications - I don't need notifications for everything, pro ads remain even though it says I'm pro, I don't like that I can't remove the sorting that shows when added, i.e. "Today", 11/4, etc, I like a running list that allows me to sort by my priority.

LOVE THIS APP!!! Just downloaded it and already seeing the benefits! The Widget helps me focus on what to do daily or weekly in a visual way. Customizing the repetition of lists and using the sub-tasks helps me to stay on point while breaking down everything into smaller bites. Personally recommend it for anyone who struggles with management and organization.

Useful app and widget but with a few draw backs stopping me from purchasing the full versions. You have to tap on the widget item circle to complete tasks, it's a small area. If you miss it, opens the app. Overall, I'm happy so far. Will decide at the end of the month to see if worth purchasing the full version.

It's a great idea, still need to work some kinks out. I absolutely LOVE the way this app is laid out. It's super easy to use and I like that I can separate things into categories. I can put notes about where appointments are and how they went. I can get reminders the day before. All that being said, there are a few things holding me back from a 5 star and getting a premium account. I've had some issues with the app changing the time of an event. I also am unable to sync with my new device.

Even if I am just using the free version and not the pro, the app is good and perfect for a busy person like me. I can keep track of my tasks because of the task tracker, it reminds you five minutes before the time that you set for the task, and it has different tas categories which you can add more if the task you are looking for is not in the options. The themes are simple and aesthetic, relaxing to look at and helps to make the tasks look more organize. Highly recommended!

Everything is great. It does take a bit getting used to and figuring out where everything is. One big set back is that it doesn't sync well throughout my devices. If I have the account on more than one device and switch to a different device, the account doesn't sync. Another setback is when I open the app, I always have to set it to sort it by "due date and time." This is needed even after I adjust something, so I need to do it literally everytime. Please fix these and I'll give it a 5 stars.
I6j64d: Dairy App & Notes & Audio Editor & Voice Recorder
ras4vb: Hi, thanks for your feedback. Please click the in-app sidebar - Settings - Account Sync to enable automatic sync. Then log into the same account on different devices. Thank you for your support! ðŸŒ¹

review: I found the app very useful and easy to use. The only thing I dont like is that when you want to set repetitive reminder for shorter perior, such as every 2 or 3 hours, there is no time range when reminder would should active and when it should not, so it keeps reminding you even at the time you are asleep. I have contacted the developers to ask if there is such a feature and maybe missed it but after nearly 2 weeks I got no answer. Also it rings as an alarm.when I selected notification

review: The app is annoying. If I'm adding the plus on my "personal", that means it goes to my personal. They put it in some other place and you have to search for it. The fact that you need an expensive subscription to add a picture is ridiculous. The biggest thing were the widgets. You can only add one 4x3 because you can't have one "personal" and one "wishlist" of the same size. Not worth even $5. If I have my tasks in order, don't randomize them again when I add another task. Terrible app.
I6j64d: Dairy App & Notes & Audio Editor & Voice Recorder

review: From all the schedule planners and/or to-do list apps I've used, this is so far the best and works with me well. I love how minimalistic it is with the relevant features. The only bad thing about it is the frequent ads (considering that I'm not using the pro version). Also, hoping this would be available for desktops too.

The app's great, I like how minimalistic it is but I would add some color options to the font or anything that has to do with color to organize your stuff. Adding a Pomodoro sounds good too, but overall the app is great :)) I liked this because out of all the to-do list apps, this is the only one that has the attachment/link and notes option when making your task, it's really convenient.

review: If you don't buy a monthly or annual fee - DON'T BOTHER! It's very frustrating to use this app if you're trying the free trial. The app only keeps new tasks for 3 days, so if you don't do those tasks literally every day, it just deletes your work!! 3 days isn't really long enough to know how well a habit tracking app will work for you in the long run... Shouldn't offer a free trial If the app won't even keep tasks for you by the time you'd want to get around to possibly purchasing a plan!

review: App is great but there is one very annoying bug that needs to be fixed soon. If you choose to sort your tasks manually it will rearrange all the items on the list when you exit the app and open it next time. Sometimes I spend a lot of time sorting the tasks on the list for some job and it goes all in vain when I exit the app as it rearranges them randomly.

review: Today my to do list app decided to give me a persistent notification of my tasks for the day, starting at the last task of the day, and then showing me the two before it. I figured out it thought those were overdue tasks from yesterday, even though in the app they were not overdue. Swiping them individually did dismiss them. Turning off daily reminders and seeing if that breaks the rest of the app or fixes this problem.

Your ad experience is predatory and makes one actively not want to support due to it's puzzle difficulty. That said if you combine the task view and the calendar view with the weekly along the top and ability to swipe side to side to advance days or switch to monthly to check what you've done on what days in the past quickly, then you'd have a winner. Once that's done, reply and I'll fix my score a bit and if I haven't found an app that does (Bright ToDo is so close, but has bugs) I'll buy.
I6j64d: Dairy App & Notes & Audio Editor & Voice Recorder
ras4vb: Hi, thanks for your feedback. Click the arrow before or after the month to switch months, and click the date on the calendar to switch days. Thank you for your support!ðŸ’—

Most useful features are blocked in the free version, no way to see how they work before you buy. For the most part, this app is nothing but a big commercial pushing you to buy the app and whatever else is being advertised. Solution: provide a free evaluation of a fully functioning app for 30 days.

review: Somehow this app doesn't handle daylight savings time, so you get to adjust every single task you have, every time the time changes. In addition to being a massive PITA for users, I can't imagine how any competent developer wouldn't handle DST flawlessly, for an app that relies on timely reminders as a primary feature.

Great app! Just like the Mood Tracker of these same developers, it is easy to navigate and has great aesthetics. I am also interested to see a Pomodoro Timer App from the developers since they are rather good at organizing data and tracking progress of activities and all. The developers would surely make a great pomodoro app given the interfaces they have been putting out.

Honestly, this app is one of, if not the best reminder apps I encountered ever. The only downside is the pricing ðŸ¤£ but I guess that's the part that keeps this app updating. Keep it up, devs! Oh, and also one small thing: Please make it so when you add a task through a widget of a certain category, the new task is also set in that category. That would help a lot ;)
In short good to go. You will get all the things which you want in this app. Message for authors : please provide some more themes and widgets options for free version. Overall very good product

Very useful. No point buying a planner, yearly diary or calendar when you can use this. It's easy to use and helpful. I use it to remember birthdays coming up, put events in it and to keep up to date with my college work. It can be used for anything though. It comes with preset categories like work personal and birthdays but you can add your own and use it for anything.
The app's great and all but I'm not a big fan of having subscriptions for a simple, virtual to-do list. Would not recommend the paid features but the free side is alright.
